summary: The Gun Safety Board and Research Act (HR 4882) proposes the establishment of a Gun Safety Board under the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The board's responsibilities include conducting and funding research on firearm violence reduction, publishing policy recommendations, and analyzing the impact of firearm violence on various areas, from domestic violence to healthcare expenditures. The bill also specifies the composition, appointment process, and duties of the board members. It authorizes appropriations for research and prohibits the diversion of existing federal gun violence research funds.
